intro: Pleione incrassata, commonly known as the thickened pleione, is a rare and striking orchid native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers with a unique combination of colors, often featuring a deep violet or purple hue. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions with well-drained soil. Its rhizomes are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water and nutrients in its natural habitat. Due to its rarity and beauty, it is highly sought after by orchid enthusiasts and conservationists alike.
